repo.name: ddns-go
repo.description: Simple and easy to use DDNS. Support Aliyun, Tencent Cloud, Dnspod, Cloudflare, Callback, Huawei Cloud, Baidu Cloud, Porkbun, GoDaddy, Namecheap, NameSilo...

readme.summary: Well-structured documentation with excellent installation instructions and webhook examples, but lacks upfront quick start guidance and comprehensive troubleshooting section.
readme.top_issue: No clear quick start example at the beginning - users must scroll through installation options before understanding basic usage flow (web UI at localhost:9876 is mentioned mid-section)

injection_risks.description: The `exec.Command` function is used with user-controlled input, which can lead to command injection attacks.
The `osutil.StartDetachedProcess` function is used with user-controlled input, which can lead to command injection attacks.

critical_findings: Command injection vulnerability in the `exec.Command` function.
Potential for insecure connections due to the `skipVerify` flag being set to false by default.
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities and potential for insecure connections, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows good practices.

common_complaints: Domain handling issues with subdomain parsing (Cloudflare secondary domains)
Missing DNS provider support (name.com, SVCB records)
Log file location documentation and startup options
praise_themes: Active feature requests showing community engagement
Users attempting to work within project constraints
sentiment.summary: ddns-go shows moderate community health with engaged users requesting features and reporting bugs, but some technical issues remain unresolved and maintainer response times vary.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are somewhat helpful but lack clarity, patience, and technical depth, which may discourage new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (suggests repository state inconsistency or no active development)
23 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active contribution intake
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date makes version stability unclear
positive_signals: Repository exists and has some historical activity
No abandoned indicators like archived status
maintenance.summary: The ddns-go project shows signs of stagnation with no commits, merged PRs, or active contributors over the past 6 months despite having multiple unresolved open issues.

project_metrics.description: Simple and easy to use DDNS. Support Aliyun, Tencent Cloud, Dnspod, Cloudflare, Callback, Huawei Cloud, Baidu Cloud, Porkbun, GoDaddy, Namecheap, NameSilo...

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is well-structured and provides detailed information, but some sections could be improved for better clarity and conciseness.
concerns: Docs: Lack of a dedicated troubleshooting section with common issues and solutions.
Community: feature requests not being addressed
Security: Command injection vulnerability in the `exec.Command` function.
Security: Potential for insecure connections due to the `skipVerify` flag being set to false by default.
Security: The `exec.Command` function is used with user-controlled input, which can lead to command injection attacks.
highlights: Frequent commits in the past 6 months (29)
Active issue closure (45 closed issues in 6 months)
Multiple active contributors (13 in the past 6 months)
